item.description:
RT‚ÄÇJacob Lee
Had a üî• time live with @crtr0 and Alex Leventer on using @DataStax AstraDB, @LangChainAI, and @vercel to build WikiChat!

ICYMI, watch the VOD, read about it in the blog, or try it! Super interesting ingest pipeline too:

https://www.datastax.com/blog/wikipedia-chatbot-using-astradb-langchain-and-vercel

https://wikich.at

item.description:
RT‚ÄÇCobus Greyling
Visualise & Discover RAG Data

RAGxplorer is a web-based GUI for importing, chunking, mapping & exploring semantic similarity.

RAGxplorer is a work in progress, and a number of improvements came to mind.

But it is a very timely development, considering the necessary focus‚Ä¶

item.title: ü§ñAgent Toolkits: SQL Agents offer a natural language interface over SQL DBs: 1‚É£ The agent converts natural language questions to SQL 2‚É£ SQL query...
item.description:
ü§ñAgent Toolkits: SQL

Agents offer a natural language interface over SQL DBs:

1‚É£ The agent converts natural language questions to SQL
2‚É£ SQL query is executed by the agent
3‚É£The agent summarizes results from SQL query execution

We've recently updated our SQL agent toolkit‚Ä¶

item.title: RT Jacob Lee: üö∞üêû JS Stream Error Handling üêûüö∞ You can catch immediate streaming errors in @LangChainAI JS/TS core 0.1.17! The .stream() met...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇJacob Lee
üö∞üêû JS Stream Error Handling üêûüö∞

You can catch immediate streaming errors in @LangChainAI JS/TS core 0.1.17!

The .stream() method now awaits the first chunk, letting you return a 4/5xx HTTP code on initial failure *before* starting a response stream:

https://js.langchain.com/docs/guides/deployment/#error-handling

item.title: RT Tomaz Bratanic: We added two improvements to @neo4j wrapper in @LangChainAI : * Define transaction timeout: You can terminate a transaction if it t...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇTomaz Bratanic
We added two improvements to @neo4j wrapper in @LangChainAI :

* Define transaction timeout: You can terminate a transaction if it that takes more the than timeout threshold

* Sanitize values: Remove embedding like properties from response to avoid using them in context of RAG

item.title: RT Jacob Lee: ü¶úüèì Call LangServe Chains from JS ü¶úüèì There's a simpler way to call Python LangServe chains from frontend JS envs (e.g. Next.j...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇJacob Lee
ü¶úüèì Call LangServe Chains from JS ü¶úüèì

There's a simpler way to call Python LangServe chains from frontend JS envs (e.g. Next.js) in @LangChainAI JS/TS 0.1.5!

RemoteRunnable exposes the familiar LCEL invoke/batch/stream interface for hosted chains:

https://js.langchain.com/docs/ecosystem/langserve
